Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Sreejan D
Reviews.Content: Situated along the Maramara sea on the Kennedy road, the hotel is very cozy. The rooms are not that big but its comfortable. Try to select the sea facing rooms as on the other side there is nothing to view ! The location is good, its very close to the Topkapi Palace, and the old Istanbul are is pretty nearby. The breakfast is good and the people are polite. They can arrange a cab for you. Apart from the size of the rooms everything was good for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the view”
Reviews.Author: Sea7s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only if you want to woke up in the morning to an excellent view of the sea. Other than that there is noting their. The location is not great. The room is very small and not clean. Sleeping quality is not the best as you get a double size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good location!”
Reviews.Author: Green22Georgia
Reviews.Content: There was 3 of us sharing a well appointed and modern triple room with ample space. We had a quiet room with a balcony overlooking the Marmara Sea. It also had a flat screen tv with a good selection of channels and a mini refrigerator. The bathroom was like new with amenities such as bedroom shoes, loofahs, soaps & shampoos. The staff was friendly and helpfull caterring to our every need. Breakfast was included and it was one of the best we have ever had in our travels. The location was good and we could walk to most all of the major attractions and restaurants. There is a tram station nearby and we took to the train to the Galata Bridge for around $1.00 and caught a ferry over to the Asian side and back for less than $5.00. A cheap way to see Istanbul by day and night. Anyway, our stay at the Citadel made for a great trip and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “the best of the best of the best , don't waste your money booking else where .”
Reviews.Author: ahmed_m111
Reviews.Content: excellence in all aspects , starting from the reservation manager mr.ozdemir which his warm welcoming reply increases the high expectations to find in this hotel , and the warm and friendly manners of the whole staff like mr. turker and mr.masiut and mr.ozan , and the lovely polite lady accountant and more , they are always there for you to help you at any time day or night ,, rooms are great ,, breakfast is always a joy , hotel is just across the street to the beautiful sensational sea of marmara ,, just go there and leave every thing to the hotel to take care of .

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sara121_12
Reviews.Content: We had good time at the Best West Citadel Hotel. It has good staff but nosy!! The view of room is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: annereynolds
Reviews.Content: a fantastic find, right on the water dividing Europe and Asia, with barges and cruise ships sailing by all the time...request a room overlooking the water a beautiful breakfast patio very centrally located and an easy walk to the Blue Mosque and the ancient Sophia church many restaurants and very safe at night to walk and the people are friendly and accommodating you can walk to the Grand Bazaar and must visit the Spice Market...fantastic and half an hour's walk uphill another must see is the ancient underground Roman Resevoir An amazing city with a mix of cultures

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: VLEUS
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Best Western Citadel in Istanbul. We booked it thanks to the good reviews in Trip Advisor, and we are not disappointed. The hotel is good. Our room was quite small, and not facing the sea, but it was the cheapest one and we just went there to sleep. You have so many things to visit and do in Istanbul that staying in your hotel room is almost a sin. Anyway, the room was spotless clean, good air conditioning (hot or cold), good amenities in the bathroom, free safe for your belongings, TV with international channels, a free bottle of mineral water every dayâ€¦ And the breakfast was very good, with a great selection of cheeses, olives, cereals, eggs, omeletâ€™s and even waffles. Orange juice, on the contrary, was quite bad, but it is the only thing I wouldnâ€™t recommend from the breakfast. Plus you have a fantastic view of the Marmara Sea while you are eating your breakfast. I suppose that in the summer, you could have your breakfast in the terrace. The hotel is situated in the touristic area, at about 8-10 minutes from the Blue Mosque and Santa Sofia. You can go walking from there to the place where you can take the ferries to the Asian side of the city. There are lots of restaurants in the area (most of them for tourists), but some are good enough to have a nice dinner, and you can also find bars to have a beer or two if you want. Again, we enjoyed our stay at Best Western Citadel and we would recommend it without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful; great location”
Reviews.Author: uofmgrl80
Reviews.Content: Love love love this hotel!! Such a cute place - not like the Best Westerns in the states. The staff were so incredibly friendly and helpful. We were picked up at the airport with the shuttle (our names were a bit misspelled but that's fine) and they accomodated us by scheduling the return trip to the airport when we wanted to go. We exchanged money at the front desk with ease, and the breakfast buffet included a lot of decent options. Our room overlooked the Marmara Sea (beautiful!) and we could walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the tram easily, although the walk is a bit steep. We also got a large bottle of water every day. Be careful on how you get back to the hotel though - the first night we wandered the little streets for awhile before we found our hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: travelphyl
Reviews.Content: Small old city hotel, great breakfast included. Perfect Views of the Sea of Mamara....across the street. We walked everywhere, short little lovely walks. I will for sure return to this hotel, I was very pleased. No Elebator and that was the ONLY thing missing.

Reviews.Title: “What could be better? maybe an elevator....?”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTraveler_11
Reviews.Content: Began our tour of Turkey with 3 days in Istanbul at the Citadel, and am so glad we did! The location is PERFECT....beautiful view of the Sea of Marmara, yet a short jaunt out the back door took us through a quaint neighborhood to small shops with water, chips, and many of the things we forgot to pack. Up the steep hill was what we came to see: the Cistern, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, restaurants, sweet shops, the "small" bazaar. Great food at the Citadel's restaurant. A lovely lobby, informative desk help. Our "next trip" to Turkey will again be based from here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel / Decent Location.”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaIsabella
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel. The owner is a Turkish national that had been living in the United States for a very long time. Now that he's here, he's very hands on and can be found in the lobby. Very nice dinner menu. Breakfast is much better than a continental breakfast. There are 4 different kinds of olives, cheeses, breads and eggs made to order. The hotel does not have an elevator but it's only 3 floors. Also as stated the rooms are extremely small. They are modern and very clean. The hotel is down the hill from The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace. Be warned these are old cobblestone streets and you need very comfortable shoes. There's a small bazaar at the beginning of the Blue Mosque. After you leave the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, about 5-10 minute walk, on the way to the Grand Bazaar, is Starbucks. There is free wireless, spotless restroom and comfortable seating. The Grand Bazaar is a bit overwhelming and I suggest you get there early. The throngs of people is a bit much. No matter what day of the week because many come from cruises. There is a securiy guard wanding people on their way inside. The Bazaar is closed on Sundays.

Reviews.Title: “they Have it all”
Reviews.Author: Sara M
Reviews.Content: I could say Citadel Hotel is PERFECT. great location,only 10 min walk to the tram station which gets you everywhere, 10 minute walk to the most famous attractions (St. Sophia &Blue mosque) the whole neighborhood is the old city, which I love walking through. Rooms are fully equipped. more than we needed... although a bit small (since we had a baby crib added) Breakfast buffet with everything you wish for Staff is very friendly &helpful (we asked a lot about how&where to go in Istanbul and they were never bored of us) specially Mr.Massoud. we had a 1 year old baby, yet we enjoyed the stay as they made it as comfortable for us as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Sarah K
Reviews.Content: I can only recommend the Citadel hotel in Istanbul: comfortable rooms, good service, nice sea view. Close to the sightseeing highlights and nevertheless located in a quiet area. We had some wonderful days there. We particularly liked the kindness and cooperativeness of the staff, particularly Mr. Turker has really helped us during our stay. We will certrainly come back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of the whole trip to Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice, for two nights at the beginning and three nights at the end of a tour of western Turkey. It was by far my favorite hotel of the trip for many reasons---1) the location was superb, an easy walk to the Blue Mosque, St Sophia Church, and Topkapi Palace 2) the views from the lovely cafe and restaurant and most of the rooms out over the Marmara Sea are fantastic, 3) the staff is friendly, helpful, and goes way above and beyond in customer service. All the creature comforts are here, too: free and reliable wifi internet in each room as well as the common areas; an electric teapot and tray stocked with coffee and tea supplies, a minibar/frig with room to put your own items in, a large jug of bottled water supplied each day (free). The rooms are large enough to be comfortable, and the bathrooms/shower are plenty big, too. I just can't say enough about this hotel, and when I come back to Istanbul, you can bet I'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “again at Citadel hotel in Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: marilena_daniel
Reviews.Content: if you're being confused by the multitude of hotels in Istanbul, you can choose Citadel hotel, and take it for granted...you'll not be disappointed.I've been there for the 3rd time and if i could i would give it another 'star'...First of all, the location is perfect with the Marmara in your eyes every morning at breakfast.Rooms are very clean, the staff very respectful and friendly, and from reception desk you can get all the informations and help you need ( ask there for Turker, and count on his best will to make your staying at Citadel very pleasant ...) In my opinion, that is a hotel where nobody can have complaints...

Reviews.Title: “Only ate here, nice views”
Reviews.Author: saranger
Reviews.Content: Had a farewell dinner here on a group tour of Turkey. Meal was a set menu and consisted of salad, vegetable borek, and a beef with potatoes and vegetables. Service was unobtrusive and food tasty, if a bit uninspired (I understand the challenges of feeding 38 people with different tastes). Views of the Bosphorus are lovely, especially at sunset. Location is in Old Town and close to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: key d
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent at all time! Food is excellent, fresh and lots of variety They go beyond your expectation to please you Employees make you feel at home. We were a group of 8 for 5 nights, left there very happy, i will certainty go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience at BW Citadel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SajiaDhaka
Reviews.Content: We were staying at Istanbul for a few nights and the hotel offered great price for good value. The location was excellent in Sultanamet area and the hotel overlook the Sea of Marmara. The rooms had great view of the Sea with a balcony. The room size is small for family but well maintained. The staff are very friendly and helpful guides. The breakfast was healthy with many options.

Reviews.Title: “paradise situated with the view of Marmara sea!! argiro”
Reviews.Author: argiro c
Reviews.Content: a beatuful accomodation of high quality in an excellent location a breath away from all the important sites. The view from the rooms window breath taking and the visitors had the feeling of standing of a ship's deck. The stuff waw more than friendly, the receptionist Mr. Turker showed an unexpected tolerence to the hundreds of questions we posed to him.Even thow we travelled on our own the hotel its self made as feel so secure and so welcome!!!! Every time we returned to the hotel i felt as i was returning home!!!! One thing is for sure that next time i will visit my beloved Instabul i was stay at home, at Citadel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Susanne F
Reviews.Content: Best Western Citadel in Istanbul is one of the nicest hotels IÂ´ve ever stayed at. The hotel is situated on the border to Marmara-lake so the view from the room and restaurants are absolutely beautiful, you even see Asia from there. The staff are VERY friendly and forthcoming. Nothing was impossible or boring to deal with for them. Every matter was taken care of with a smile. Our room was a bit small for three ladies but worked. The cleaning was good, we even had some extra scrubs to take home. Breakfast was good, though we were a bit careful to try everything. If you want they will cook you an omelette or make a waffle. Fresh fruit is served as well as bread and youghurt. I will really recommend this hotel, I enjoyed every minute!

Reviews.Title: “nice view and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: taghreed_ali
Reviews.Content: for the second time we choose to stay in citadel hotel, its location near to blue mosque, topkapi and ayasophia with great sea view rooms. the hotel is relatively small it give it high privacy Staff are very caring and helpful we really enjoyed our vacation in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise on all accounts”
Reviews.Author: hjwinokur
Reviews.Content: A room was available when we arrived a 9am and even though it was an seaview upgrade we were given it at the booked price. As I had read in other reviews, the room was small but it had all the necessary amenities and was very clean. The included breakfast included more than anyone could eat and was delicious. The front desk staff was most helpful. In addition, the taxi office is around the corner so they can call one at any time and they arrive within minutes. All taxi fares they quoted were accurate. They even helped get directions to a site which was off the beaten path by pulling up a ggole map and shoing the taxi driver. The hotel faces the Mamara and is across from a beautiful park. It took us only 10 or 15 minute to walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace. Restaurants and shop was plentiful along the whole walking route. The only caution to guests is that there is no elevator. But it is only three floors. If we are ever able to return to Istanbul, this would be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and location”
Reviews.Author: kkrein
Reviews.Content: While my staying in the hotel i was reallly happy because the hotel was close almost every place in the old city of istanbul. it was 7 mins to Bluemosque and 8 mins to the Hagia Sophia... thanx for a looooot and price is reasonable for the view, the location and the service that they provide.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location and we are sure to be back”
Reviews.Author: internet99
Reviews.Content: Best Western Citadel has amazing staff . they take care of u very well.The location is amzing.It is 7 mins to blue mosque and few more mins to aghya sophia.it takes 15 mins to Topkapi palace.it takes few mins to reach the bus stand and the metro station.the food is very good.the break feast has a variety of bread salads etc.the lunch and dinner has a good menu.but the best part is almost all rooms face the marmara sea.I would want to be back to Istanbul and would stay only in best western citadel.I would recommend this hotel for people who come to Istanbul for a family holiday

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for a first time visit!”
Reviews.Author: cosmic_scene
Reviews.Content: The BW Citadel looks newly renovated with really helpful staff this hotel was clean, very warm with each room having individual AC/WarmAir control (it was freezing outside), powerful shower with loads of hot water and a fantastic bar overlooking the night lights of the sea and Istanbul. This hotel faces the Bhosporus and is on the outer rim of the ancient City walls a leisurely 10 minute walk (up a curvy hill) leading to the heart of the historic zone. The spires of the Blue Mosque can be seen within minutes from the hotel and the majestic Hagia Sophia, the famous Bazaar, the caverns of the Basiica (as seen in a Connery James Bond movie) are all within minutes walk from eachother! A tramline which runs along the centre of town is clean, inexpensive with automated ticketing and very frequent. You can't get lost as the tram just runs in a straight route and teminates near one of the palaces. Watch out when crossing the main road though as it is deceptively quiet until a speeding trams turns the corner - keep to the pedestrian crossing. A few stops along from this zone takes you to the main ferry port where you can purchase a day trip to one of the outer islands near the Black Sea or alittle further if you wish for as little as Â£30 return trip with enough time for lunch and a bit of exploring before your return trip. The ferries are again very warm, clean with both 'turkish' and european style toilets. The waterfront palaces, mosques, ancient churches, forts and colonial dutch style wooden frame houses make Istanbul the perfect city for architectural lovers! Many buildings are being renovated and the Central and Spice Market (by the ferry dock) are a must see, even though much of what they sell can easily be found down Camden Market! This is a great hotel for a first time visit to Istanbul with rooms facing the icy blue of the Bhosporus. The road is noisy when the double-glazed windows are opened but this is due to the road surface rather than traffic, and the sunrise and sunsets over the Bhosporus are truly beautiful. Ignore all the jovial heckles from the restaurants and shops along the road leading to the historic zone as there are quite a few busy eateries along the main drag. The people are lovely and the cleanliness of even the 'tourist' dogs and cats puts London to shame!

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely be back in Istanbul and won't be staying anywhere else but here!”
Reviews.Author: Sloomz
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Citadel Hotel was the absolute perfect hotel to stay in. Not only was it of premium quality at a very affordable price, but its location combined with the helpfulness and warmth of the hotel staff made Istanbul a dream destination for us. The hotel was located less than 5 minutes away from the Sultanahmet district, where the majority of Istanbul's attractions are located. Additionally, it only took us 10-15 minutes to get to the city's downtown district, Taksim Square, from our hotel. The hotel staff always assisted in getting us taxis and in recommending tours and attractions to us. They truly went the extra mile in ensuring our highest level of comfort throughout our stay. The hotel was extremely clean, offered daily breakfast, a delicious restaurant and room service and daily housekeeping was always prompt and efficient. Apart from this, we had free Wi-Fi in our room, which was easier than 1-2-3 to connect to. The most enjoyable part of the stay was the stunning view over the Marmara Sea. I very strongly recommend staying at this hotel as it is a vacation within your vacation in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: gmkandkh
Reviews.Content: If the money is getting out of your pocket, you will not find a better deal. The hotel is located on a main street, that is, no need to drag your wheeled luggage on those stone paved streets and you save on transport to and from the airport, and if you like using trains, the station is only 50 yards away, direct to the airport. In addition the hotel is only 10 minutes walk from the main landmarks of Istanbul. Service and maintenance were very good and the personnel are very friendly. The room is little tight, but nice and clean. After all, all I need is a neat and clean room to shower and sleep. In addition we were greeted with a basket of fresh fruits. A free bottled water is available every night. The breakfast, which was included, was delicious and very satisfying, specially the turkish cheeses and jams. It was not short of anything. If you like to stay connected, they have excellent fast internet connections thru several access points well placed in the different areas of the hotel. To top that, it is free. My wife and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel and enjoyed it a lot and we had not one single issue. We give it Excellent rating for a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Marmara”
Reviews.Author: Marian090
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at the BW Citadel waiting for an early flight home. We loved the quietness of the hotel considering it was on a busy major thoroughfare. The staff were very kind in preparing an very early morning breakfast at 5 a.m. The bedroom suite contained a tea kettle with a selection of teas - a thoughtful gesture for any traveller. If we were to go back to Istanbul we definitely would stay at the Citadel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent team work!”
Reviews.Author: Doridev
Reviews.Content: Wondeful staff and friends! Turker masut (mr cherry)dursun! Thank you very much for all your help and friendship!! You made a difference during our stay "Home away from home" saludos to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Ä±t was perfect vacatÄ±on”
Reviews.Author: desparus
Reviews.Content: We stayed Bw Citadel Hotel last week with my family.We spend there good tÄ±me everythÄ±ngs was wonderfull.Staff was very proficÄ±onal,service was excellent also we had supper at the SomÄ±ne Restaurant Ä±t was very delÄ±cous .It was lookÄ±ng Marmara Sea

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: nonews0
Reviews.Content: Overall - good deal for the money. Pros: location; staff; clean; sea view. Cons: the rooms are quite small; walls are literally "transparent" in terms of sound; breakfast menu definitely needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: ElenaGM
Reviews.Content: We loved the location! On Kennedy street, right by the sea. We had no noise issues. Rooms are petite but very clean! Staff is extremely polite and helpful. We were in Turkey before...so we expected no less...but for our american friends, this was their first time in Istanbul and Turkey and I am happy to say everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoloChickinLA
Reviews.Content: Picturesque hotel, big breakfast every morning, two on-site restaurants, attractive lobby, delightful. Hotel is right across the street from the ocean, so views from the cafe are fantastic. Room service was very good. English language stations on the tv & WiFi worked perfectly. The only drawbacks--which are minor--is that it's not on a street with any shopping, but you're less than a five minute walk to get to that--and walls are a bit thin, so you do occasionally hear other guests. About a 35 TL cab ride from airport & about a 10 minute walk from Sultanahmet tram stop. Great hot water & water pressure in the shower. Friendly desk staff. Would absolutely stay here again if I ever had to stay in Sultanahmet again (I didn't like Sultanahmet--other parts of Istanbul are less manic & overtouristed and I recommend you search them out. Even staying just off the Blue Mosque area, for example in the Gulahane neighborhood, is preferrable to staying within 1000 feet of the Blue Mosque area).

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and familiar ambient due to their staff”
Reviews.Author: JoseManuelMartin
Reviews.Content: Briefly : -Excellent staff , always profesional and helpful -Very nice breakfast -Small rooms in some cases but the standard is big enough and the cost is very reasonable -Good location in Sultanahmet , close to : -Many restaurants , AyaSofia , Blue mosque , Galata bridge ,grand bazaar less than 5 minutes walking - In front of Marmara sea ( perfect for runners ) -40TL taxi to Ataturk

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: customers0708
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was spotlessly clean in a great location and the staff very helpful We had a seaview room which I would recommend. The breakfast which was included in the price was excellent and we also ate at the restaurant and had a very good meal. The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept very well (except for one night when the guy in the next room was making and receiving calls from 4 am )The location is very good and easy to travel all around Istanbul from. Our only negative experience of the whole holiday was the Akbiyak fish restaurant full of hidden charges ( a fish costs 120 turkish lira) but would recommend the Hamdi restaurant fantastic views and good value for money Use the back door of hotel for easy access to blue mosque and other attractions

Reviews.Title: “All Romantic Sea-Lovers.. Welcome!)”
Reviews.Author: ingenue_ing
Reviews.Content: Being in pressed choice of hotels to stay in during our family trip to Istanbul, we stopped our attention on Best Western Citadel Hotel. We were attracted by its location and pleasant ambiance. Being located at the shore of the Bosporus, the hotel is quiet comfortable and extends romantic atmosphere all around. The service and hotel staff are very friendly and hospitable, helping the visitors with their recommendations of city-sighting and other leisures in the city. The best rooms are those ones with the view of the Bosporus. The heart of Istanbul Sultan-Ahmet Mosque, the mosque-museum Aya-Sofiya, the TopKapi palace are all rather close to the hotel, along with small cafÃ©s and bazaar (market) with different types of national souvenirs. The most perfect thing in the hotel - is lovely breakfasts with the view to the sea, where you can easily find a couple of dolphins, swimming by along the shore!!! That scene really impresses much! So, briefly, if you do prefer quiet, romantic and lovely atmosphere, where you can spend your time in an unforgettable way - you should definitely visit this hotel!.. Bon voyage a vous!)

Reviews.Title: “thank you very muchh”
Reviews.Author: forcan
Reviews.Content: Celebrated the New Year with friends at the hotel. Very pleased with everything we had was excellent. Accommodations at the hotel for everyone at least once a citadel recommend Istanbul. Everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel soever in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KTAMAM
Reviews.Content: This hotel characteristic of sightly location that outlook on the sea. It's the best hotel soever. Every thing complete (worker dealing-eating-cleanLiness.....etc) Thanks for all people who reponsible for citadel quality as manager-staff-with special thanks to very kind receptionist mesut

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lukasz1979
Reviews.Content: I recommend Citadel Hotel to everybody. Hotel has a great location, nice clean rooms. We had rooms with a street view and it was very quiet. Breakfast was very good - plenty of food to choose. Enjoy the stay in Istanbul! :)

Reviews.Title: “Warm hotel and friendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: james00144
Reviews.Content: I was in Citadel hotel last month and i had amazing time in there. First of all, employes are such a friendly and warm. The hotel had clean room and nice cafe. When we were drink our coffees in there we saw perfect sea. I felt i was in the paradise. Secondly, they have perfect breakfast buffet and we found what we wanted to eat. their breakfast room was comfortable and all stuff was cheerful. I wanna say thank you to Citadel Hotel Management because they built perfect system for all the guests.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Summer”
Reviews.Author: ttonnu07
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided for my 22nd birthday that we would go to Istanbul in order to celebrate this occasion. We've heard great things about this hotel before choosing it for this occasion and this hotel did not disappoint us. Our experience with checking-in was simple and quick even though the hotel was very busy. The service was great; the employees were friendly and helpful. The view from our room was outstanding and we even got breakfast included with our stay which was great! The hotel is located closely to Aghia Sophia and Blue Mosque and it is located in the middle of the Old City so there are plenty to things to explore during your stay! I would go back to this place in a heart beat:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough Hotel but not for Business traveller”
Reviews.Author: stoneybroke01
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff who tried to help Very small rooms with limited desk space to work - hard wooden chairs - lack of comfort. Front rooms noisy as on main road but view is great. Ventilation system is not great and often got smell of smoke coming in from smoking rooms. Breakfast average but sufficient TV - advertised as having four English language channels including news and BBC prime - these were not available and TV recption on all but three Turkish channels were poor WiFi available but had limited connectivity - hotel tried to rectify but often restricted to local. No hard connection VPN Restuerant was closed for two nights without notification - Sauturday for a wedding and Sunday for - I never found out. I was there for seven nights and this was too long given lack of comfort in room and lack of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: NorseTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the outskirts of the old city, a five to ten minute walk from the main sites. The rooms were comportable and clean with a nice bathroom. The rooms overlooking the Bosphorus can be a bit noisy due to traffic, but the back of the hotel is nice and quiet. The reseption staff were extremely helpful and friendly, giving advice and arranging bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: NarendraLucknow
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel and located at about 10-15 minutes walk from Blue Mosque, Sofia and Topkapi Palace (major attractions of Istanbul). Hotel staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for a trip to istanbul”
Reviews.Author: marilena_daniel
Reviews.Content: very nice and clean hotel, the rooms are big enough, it's situated on the shore of marmara sea ( and has beautiful view, which is hard to find at others hotels in istanbul), the staff is very friendly and willing to help u with anything u might need (and if u get there ask to the front desk for Turker Subasi, which is very profesional , polite and nice guy, and he will try to solve all the problems u might have during your staying there). i've been already twice at citadel hotel, and for sure next time in istanbul i will make the same choice !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Enzo1959
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 8 nights in October 2010 with family. Got nice junior suite with balcony for fair price. Excellent service minded staff, especially in the reception. Very helpful regarding booking tours, restaurants and any other needs. Breakfast and dinner was superb, taken into acount that this is a 3 star hotel. Highway next to hotel with loads of traffic, but nice and quiet inside. Short way, few minutes walk, to Blue Moscue and Hadia Sofia, Cisterne, Grand Bazar. Nice, but rather expensive, seafood restaurant near by (sur Balik)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: Rajab-Zahrani
Reviews.Content: I have been so many places in the world but this time at Citadel Hotel was excellent and fabulous in its services, staff, and the location. I spent 12 great days with my family in this hotel in a very nice suite (one large room with small room). The main room has large sitting area, Two full baths with a Jacuzzi in the main room. A large with nice balcony with wonderful view of the sea of Marmara. The staff were excellent and willing to go the extra mile to help us with many different things. We especially appreciated Turker's personalized help, but all the other staff were exceptional as well. Easy to walk to the sites or to get a taxi or metro anywhere else. Breakfast was wonderful with many choices, including Turkish, but also international. We are hoping to return to Istanbul and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable - a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JUL16
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a splendid stay at the Citadel, satff all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet great, rooms clean, modern and cosy. Ideally positioned for trips to the city and, within walking distance of many restuarants and tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, perfect service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Erko82
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a weekend and I really enjoyed my time there. The location is perfect, nearby oldtown and very close to Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. The service and people are charming and very helpful. Many thanks to all Citadel personel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, poor air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: foxurs1
Reviews.Content: The good things first: location is excellent in Sultanahmet, 5 minutes walk to the two main mosques, 15 mins. walk to the Grand Basar, and next door to the Topkapi, overlooking the Marmara sea front. BUT: it's on the main (motorway) road into the city & to the airport. If you want to sleep, take the back rooms. DO inspect the rooms first. They are all tiny! The air con does not work (or they are saving on electricity, mostly on generator). The air in the rooms was extremely poor with cigarette smoke filtering to all rooms. There appear to be few non-smoking rooms. The breakfasts are excellent and the reception staff are truly lovely and v. helpful. We moved rooms three times to get air and sleep. But did not sleep for three nights. The Blue Mosque Minarette is at the back; the first chant to pray starts at 5.45 a.m. Take ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Two tumbs up”
Reviews.Author: traveler20151
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the best location,on the coast line of the marmara sea next to the major sites and museums,and very close to main transportation hubs,by land or sea. They offer a great breakfast on the terresse facing the sea.The prices are reasonable and the hotel is very clean and comfortable and quiet with helpful staff. If you stay at least four nights,you're entitled to a free dinner and one transfer to the airport. I will stay there again on my nnext trip to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with the best service”
Reviews.Author: MongolianKing
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel comparing to the many hotels I have stayed all other places. However, given the congested condition of Istanbul, it is afterall not too bad. Other than that, it is a great hotel located right in front of the sea. Very convenient and safe to go and visit the historical places such as the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazzar, and etc on foot or by other means such as taxi, metro or buses. It is also very convenient to go to the airport and to both the Euro and Asian side of the islands. Best of all, the people here are very friendly and helpful in providing info and help you need, any help really you can think of or running into. If you are lucking to have Mr. Turker, the receptionist here, you will find him especially helpful in providing info, finding solutions for any of your concerns or issues. A local guy with worldly service attitude. It is my first trip to Istanbul and I did run into many issues even though I have been a world traveler if I can proudly say so. Overall, I would give it a big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bronatla
Reviews.Content: Location in old city sensational. Only a couple of minutes walk to all the sites and restaurants. Laundry by the kilo is close by. Found the cost of food and drinks to be a little high but the location and facilities made up for this. Lovely view of the water and a balcony to watch the world go by. Walk the water front to see the BBQs at night. Just charming

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: AfrTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Citadel Suite which is lovely. Two separate rooms with a queen in the main room and two twins in the second. Two full baths with a jacuzzi in the main. A large sitting area with a couch, comfortable chairs, and a large dining table. LCD TV's in both bedrooms. Wonderful view of the sea of Marmara. The staff were excellent and willing to go the extra mile to help us with many different things. We especially appreciated Mesut's personalized help, but all the other staff were exceptional as well. Easy to walk to the sites or to get a taxi anywhere else. Breakfast was wonderful with many choices, including Turkish, but also international. We are hoping to return to Istanbul and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and a view of the sea.”
Reviews.Author: ArtPlus
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and were absolutely delighted with the 'junior suite' room which had a small "living room" area with a TV & couch, another TV in the bedroom area and a small balcony with a direct view, just across the street, of the sea. With the fresh sea air and one had a direct appreciation of the dramatic location of Istanbul. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Hotel Manager Vedat Ergun who suggested the junior suite when he saw how much baggage we had. Using the internet was easy but there was only one computer available; most guests probably carry their own computer. An easy uphill walk to the old city to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi. Delicious and huge breakfast buffet with a variety of fresh fruit. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to start your day from and return to after a day of visiting.”
Reviews.Author: Pierre_Kingston
Reviews.Content: THis place was fabulous. I was advised to go to Taxium Square but chose this place when my wife wanted to be away from the crowds. We had a great room overlooking the water and were but 10 mins away from the Blue Mosque and other great sites. We even saw a pod of dolphins from our room on arrival. We hopped on a hop-on hop-off bus from the Blue Mosque and ..when we saw the other hotels, we were so happy of our choice. The manager and the people who worked there were just great. I would go back to this hotel in a heart beat. Thank you for the great time. Oh ya, their internet works. So many times it is included in the price but you have to struggle to get good reception. I did SKYPE back to Canada and no problems.

Reviews.Title: “I felt at home.”
Reviews.Author: raraBrazil
Reviews.Content: The loccation of the Hotel is walking distance from Haya Sofia, Blue Mosque and other most important visiting places in adition to a great view to Mahmara Sea. The bedrooms are quiet, clean, confortable with a good bath room. The service is something else. Any request, reservation, information was answered in a friendly way any time of the day by anyone of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “great view, close to everthing, friendly staff ,”
Reviews.Author: pictonmick
Reviews.Content: its all you need , good food, to start the day, close to evertyhing, but the rooms are very small, hint do not get a room facing the road ,,, traffic will keep you up all night, watch your dollar exchange, the guy in the bar/resturant tried to take me for 24$ for a cup of coffee, woooow, he poured it .took all my money smiled, i gave it back, got the money back , left, sour taste for the place,,, other than that , carry on.

Reviews.Title: “The best western citadel is my second home!”
Reviews.Author: strangerJeddah
Reviews.Content: I have been to this magnificent hotel 3 times in a year. Its location is enough to make you hold your breath. Sea front and the old city with all of its attractions is behind. The staff are very friendly; as a matter of fact most of them had become friends. So wheather you are planning a family or a couple trip, check this hotel out!

Reviews.Title: “infront u sea behind u old city stay with friendly peoples”
Reviews.Author: ziad777zz
Reviews.Content: the best place which u can choose without alot of thinking is citadel hotel it is one of the best hotels that have sea view in the old city of istanbul and only 5 mint by walking u can be in the area of blue mosque and old city of istanbul .i like so much the service and really u feel like u stay between ur family in this hotel ( contact them by Tel: [--] Email:[--] they help us alot to travel around istanbul without guid contact with Mesut Kiraz , Turker , Didem , Cenk on the resiption for more help they have good sea view resturant with good cooker and good price the manager is Vedat Ergun friendly person help us so much i hope we can meet them again next year !!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond of the Bhosphorus”
Reviews.Author: StavrapolEva
Reviews.Content: Excellent service ,delicious food,always smiling faces of staff. who is always ready to help in every step and marveleus breakfast on teras .Nice design off the rooms after decoration which are always clean .very nice location full off beauty and history.very close the old city .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CarleRennes
Reviews.Content: The location on the seaside very close to the major tourist spots is perfect. Althouh they are small, the rooms with seaview are very pleasant because they are noiseproof.Room rates are normal for Istanbul which is quite expensive with respect to Turquish average.Breakfast on the terrasse is good.

Reviews.Title: “The best View , Best service”
Reviews.Author: EgyptainTraveller
Reviews.Content: I would like to tell You all about my trip to istanbul , actually it was not my first time in istanbul , but this time was totally different, it was my honey moon , starting from the best rates i have got either from the hotel website or booking or tripadvisor , till the communication with the reservation dept. They was very helpful spec. mr. Kamer , they offered me marvellous sea view suit while i paid only for normal sea view room ( they upgraded my room also other couples room ) to sea view on Marmara sea , the helpful reception team leaded by MR.Turkar , he is a very very helpful guy, great thanks to him , he offered us alot of help in tours, destinations, even resturants , transportations, , also they offered us airport pickup for free. actually everytime am going to istanbul i will reserve in this Marvellous hotel great thanks to them .

Reviews.Title: “Great Comfort and very pleasant people....”
Reviews.Author: Atird
Reviews.Content: Staying at Best Western Citadel Hotel was like being at home but in Istanbul. It was a great hospitality and the best view one can imagine. Initially we booked for a standard room but when I saw the suite they offered I had to takeit because it was very nice and comfy and we were three. Myself, Mom, and my future Sister in Law had a great time staying for full 10 days in this georgeous hotel and its location. Close to everything and the receptionists were incredibly fast in meeting every inquiry we had. Thanks so much to Mesut and Turker and I hope to come back again to your lovely hotel. I recommend this hotel to everyone, be it single, couple or family. It is a place to be if you are visiting Istanbul. Drita

Reviews.Title: “Hassle-free stay”
Reviews.Author: surfdude39
Reviews.Content: Got a sea-view room on the second floor. The room was small but clean and with flat-screen TV (with international channels), AC, in-room safe as well as a fast and reliable WIFI connection, provided free of charge. Complimentary and above-average breakfast with hot selections. Friendly and helpful staff. Beware though that the hotel is located by a busy road and there are no public transport options near the hotel. Sultanahmet is a 10 minute walk through steep and cobbled streets and another 5 minutes and you will be in the Grand Bazaar. This is also where you will catch the tram to get to the Asian side. Taxis are relatively cheap as well. Overall a very good hotel in its category.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Izmirite
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms in this hotel, and are overall very happy with our stay. Location is perfect for sight seeing, decor is nice, and the hotel is well kept. Note that the rooms are quite small, and that the beds are rather short (and narrow). The hotel restaurant and breakfast buffet are nice, but there is no room service. The staff were universally friendly, but not always efficient. Our suite was cleaned every day during breakfast, while the ground floor room never was cleaned before 4 PM, and even then only after complaining. Similiarly, coffee set was missing from one of the rooms at check in, and was only delivered after numerous complaints over two days. Replenishment of the coffee also required multiple reminders, even when the cups had been cleaned and the minibar restocked. I feel somewhat bad writing this since the employees were so nice and some of them were obviously hard-working. Maybe they are understaffed? Summing up, the hotel itself and its location is very good, and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: tpmfoodie
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a post-cruise visit. It is within moderate walking distance of the Blue Mosque and the palace. Another couple who had cruised with us also stayed there. The small hotel was spotlessly clean, and the staff was extraordinarily helpful. We arrived hours before check-in time, and although they could not make a room available early, they stored our luggage and treated us to a drink and snack at the cafe. They helped us find the sights and shopping we needed , and arranged for honest, inexpensive cab rides to the Spice Bazaar, a recommended restaurant, and the airport. There are several restaurants and shops within an easy walk. We chose to eat in the hotel restaurant and found the service attentive and the food excellent. I have difficulty walking, and they had no elevator, so they upgraded us to a first floor suite with a balcony at no extra charge, and without us asking for it. Their cafe and restaurant overlooked the Sea of Marmara. During one of the days we stayed there, there was a wedding reception, but there was no bothersome noise associated with it. They have a computer with high speed internet and a printer in a niche off the lobby available for use of the guests, and I used it several times without waiting. I would definitely stay there again.
